<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

## Description {#details}

Information about stack frame layout on the target.

It holds the direction of stack growth, the known stack alignment on entry to each function, and the offset to the locals area.

The offset to the local area is the offset from the stack pointer on function entry to the first location where function data (local variables, spill locations) can be stored.

Definition at line 45 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/targetframelowering-h">TargetFrameLowering.h</a>.

### determineCalleeSaves() {#a2f26766f4dcfa6457ba405584a34d5c3}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void TargetFrameLowering::determineCalleeSaves (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bitvector">BitVector</a> &amp; SavedRegs, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/regscavenger">RegScavenger</a> &#42; RS=nullptr) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This method determines which of the registers reported by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterinfo/#ad71b5bc0aa81f5dec06cbfecaf2f7183">TargetRegisterInfo::getCalleeSavedRegs()</a> should actually get saved.

The default implementation checks populates the <code>SavedRegs</code> bitset with all registers which are modified in the function, targets may override this function to save additional registers. This method also sets up the register scavenger ensuring there is a free register or a frameindex available. This method should not be called by any passes outside of PEI, because it may change state passed in by <code>MF</code> and <code>RS</code>. The preferred interface outside PEI is getCalleeSaves.

### emitRemarks() {#adb7ed2036956f0c33273e908cee56ba5}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual void llvm::TargetFrameLowering::emitRemarks (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineoptimizationremarkemitter">MachineOptimizationRemarkEmitter</a> &#42; ORE) const</>}

### orderFrameObjects() {#a42fa24a22318377b109f90d4e007e0a6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual void llvm::TargetFrameLowering::orderFrameObjects (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; int &gt; &amp; objectsToAllocate) const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Order the symbols in the local stack frame.

The list of objects that we want to order is in <code>objectsToAllocate</code> as indices into the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo">MachineFrameInfo</a>. The array can be reordered in any way upon return. The contents of the array, however, may not be modified (i.e. only their order may be changed). By default, just maintain the original order.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/targetframelowering-h/#l00412">412</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/targetframelowering-h">TargetFrameLowering.h</a>.

processFunctionBeforeFrameFinalized - This method is called immediately before the specified function&#39;s frame layout (MF.getFrameInfo()) is finalized.

Once the frame is finalized, MO&#95;FrameIndex operands are replaced with direct constants. This method is optional.

### restoreCalleeSavedRegisters() {#af4e91c7e613771679b2f0e71f03b172d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual bool llvm::TargetFrameLowering::restoreCalleeSavedRegisters (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp; MBB, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a> MI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mutablearrayref">MutableArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/calleesavedinfo">CalleeSavedInfo</a> &gt; CSI, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterinfo">TargetRegisterInfo</a> &#42; TRI) const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
restoreCalleeSavedRegisters - Issues instruction(s) to restore all callee saved registers and returns true if it isn&#39;t possible / profitable to do so by issuing a series of load instructions via loadRegToStackSlot().

If it returns true, and any of the registers in CSI is not restored, it sets the corresponding Restored flag in CSI to false. Returns false otherwise.
